title: My First Solo Travel: Sagada Adventure
content:
# My First Solo Travel: Sagada Adventure

Embarking on my first solo adventure to Sagada, I booked everything myself - transportation, hotel, and tours.

## Why Solo Travel?

I wanted to challenge myself:

- Step out of my comfort zone
- Learn to be self-reliant
- Have the freedom to explore at my own pace
- Meet new people along the way

## Getting There

### The Journey

- Overnight bus from Manila to Baguio
- Morning bus from Baguio to Sagada
- Total travel time: ~12 hours

## What I Explored

With little prior knowledge of what to expect, I explored this mountain province blindly.

### Sumaguing Cave

The most famous cave in Sagada:

- Spelunking adventure
- Rope climbing and rappelling
- Underground rock formations
- Crystal-clear underground pools

### Hanging Coffins

A unique burial practice of the Igorot people:

- Coffins hung on cliff faces
- Ancient tradition dating back thousands of years
- Breathtaking views of the valley

### Kiltepan Viewpoint

> Stunning sunrise views over the sea of clouds.

Woke up at 4AM to catch the sunrise - absolutely worth it.

### Echo Valley

- Peaceful hike through pine forests
- More hanging coffins
- Serene atmosphere

## Lessons Learned

1. **You're more capable than you think** - Solo travel builds confidence
2. **Strangers can become friends** - Met amazing fellow travelers
3. **Embrace the unexpected** - The best moments are unplanned
4. **Disconnect to reconnect** - Limited signal was a blessing

> A DIY trip that taught me independence and the joy of spontaneous exploration.

## Final Thoughts

Sagada will always hold a special place in my heart as the destination of my first solo adventure. It gave me the courage to explore more of the world on my own terms.
